items.title: Ontario will pull anti-tariff ads after Trump vows to cut off trade talks with Canada
items.standfirst: President Trump said he's ending trade talks with Canada over an anti-tariff ad campaign by the province of Ontario that uses Ronald Reagan's voice — leading Ontario to pull the ads after this weekend.
items.content: President Trump said he's ending trade talks with Canada over an anti-tariff ad campaign by the province of Ontario that uses Ronald Reagan's voice — leading Ontario to pull the ads after this weekend.

items.title: Canada to pull tariff ad featuring Reagan
items.standfirst: Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.
items.content: Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.

items.title: Ontario to stop running anti-tariff advert that angered Trump
items.standfirst: The advertisement will be paused from Monday so "trade talks can resume" with the US, Doug Ford says.
items.content: The advertisement will be paused from Monday so "trade talks can resume" with the US, Doug Ford says.

items.title: Ontario pulls anti-tariff Reagan ad after Trump terminates Canada trade talks
items.standfirst: Ontario's leader Doug Ford on Friday said he would pull an anti-tariff ad campaign quoting former US president Ronald Reagan after current President Donald Trump ended trade talks with Canada.
items.content: Ontario's leader Doug Ford on Friday said he would pull an anti-tariff ad campaign quoting former US president Ronald Reagan after current President Donald Trump ended trade talks with Canada.

items.title: US and Canada spar over ad of Reagan denouncing tariffs that led to derailed trade talks
items.standfirst: Ontario premier says he plans to run ad featuring speech that sparked Trump’s ire again during World Series but campaign will end MondayAfter the US suspended all trade negotiations with Canada over a 1987 speech by Ronald Reagan denouncing tariffs that appeared to spark Donald Trump’s ire, the premier of Ontario said he planned to run an ad featuring the speech again during the World Series on Friday.Doug Ford, whose government ran the Reagan ad in US markets this week, first posted on X that the two nations were “stronger together”, while Trump added his own string of social media posts trumpeting the supposed benefits of tariffs. Continue reading...
items.content: Ontario premier says he plans to run ad featuring speech that sparked Trump’s ire again during World Series but campaign will end MondayAfter the US suspended all trade negotiations with Canada over a 1987 speech by Ronald Reagan denouncing tariffs that appeared to spark Donald Trump’s ire, the premier of Ontario said he planned to run an ad featuring the speech again during the World Series on Friday.Doug Ford, whose government ran the Reagan ad in US markets this week, first posted on X that the two nations were “stronger together”, while Trump added his own string of social media posts trumpeting the supposed benefits of tariffs. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says all Canada trade talks ‘terminated’ over ad criticising tariffs
items.standfirst: US president accuses Canada of ‘egregious behaviour’ after release of ad featuring Ronald Reagan criticising tariffsUS politics – live updatesDonald Trump has announced an immediate end to “all trade negotiations” with Canada over a television advertisement opposing US tariffs that quoted the former US president Ronald Reagan.The ad, which was paid for by the government of the Canadian province of Ontario, uses excerpts of a 1987 speech where Reagan says “trade barriers hurt every American worker”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president accuses Canada of ‘egregious behaviour’ after release of ad featuring Ronald Reagan criticising tariffsUS politics – live updatesDonald Trump has announced an immediate end to “all trade negotiations” with Canada over a television advertisement opposing US tariffs that quoted the former US president Ronald Reagan.The ad, which was paid for by the government of the Canadian province of Ontario, uses excerpts of a 1987 speech where Reagan says “trade barriers hurt every American worker”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Trump ended trade talks with Canada due to an ad criticizing US tariffs.
The ad, sponsored by Ontario, featured Ronald Reagan's voice.
Ontario planned to pull the ad after the World Series games.
The ad was paused to allow trade talks to resume with the US.
Trump expressed anger over the ad, leading to the trade talk halt.

items.title: 10/24: The Daily Report
items.standfirst: Lindsey Reiser reports on trade tensions between the U.S. and Canada over an anti-tariff ad and the U.S. sending an aircraft carrier to Latin America.
items.content: Lindsey Reiser reports on trade tensions between the U.S. and Canada over an anti-tariff ad and the U.S. sending an aircraft carrier to Latin America.

items.title: Pentagon sends US carrier to Latin America amid fears of war
items.standfirst: The Pentagon on Friday ordered the deployment of an aircraft carrier strike group to counter drug-trafficking organizations in Latin America, a major escalation of a US military buildup that Venezuela's leader warned was steered at "fabricating a war." Since September, the US has launched at least ten air attacks in the Caribbean and Pacific, killing dozens of suspected traffickers. Click on the video by FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot for more.
items.content: The Pentagon on Friday ordered the deployment of an aircraft carrier strike group to counter drug-trafficking organizations in Latin America, a major escalation of a US military buildup that Venezuela's leader warned was steered at "fabricating a war." Since September, the US has launched at least ten air attacks in the Caribbean and Pacific, killing dozens of suspected traffickers. Click on the video by FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot for more.

items.standfirst: U.S. sending aircraft carrier strike group to Latin America; Students throw surprise wedding for their beloved principal.
items.content: U.S. sending aircraft carrier strike group to Latin America; Students throw surprise wedding for their beloved principal.

items.title: US sends aircraft carrier to South America as tensions mount
items.standfirst: The Pentagon on Friday ordered the deployment of the USS Gerald R. Ford aircraft carrier and its strike group to an unidentified location off South America, a dramatic increase in regional combat power that the White House says is aimed at disrupting drug trafficking throughout the Western Hemisphere.
items.content: The Pentagon on Friday ordered the deployment of the USS Gerald R. Ford aircraft carrier and its strike group to an unidentified location off South America, a dramatic increase in regional combat power that the White House says is aimed at disrupting drug trafficking throughout the Western Hemisphere.

items.title: Pentagon "crossed this Rubicon" by sending strike group to Latin America, military analyst says
items.standfirst: The Pentagon said the U.S. is deploying the Navy's newest and most advanced aircraft carrier, the USS Gerald R. Ford, to the Caribbean, along with its strike group. The move comes as Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth posted Friday that the U.S. military carried out its tenth strike at sea on alleged drug vessels. Ret. Army Maj. Mike Lyons, a military analyst, joins CBS News to discuss.
items.content: The Pentagon said the U.S. is deploying the Navy's newest and most advanced aircraft carrier, the USS Gerald R. Ford, to the Caribbean, along with its strike group. The move comes as Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth posted Friday that the U.S. military carried out its tenth strike at sea on alleged drug vessels. Ret. Army Maj. Mike Lyons, a military analyst, joins CBS News to discuss.

items.title: U.S. sends aircraft carrier to South America in major escalation of military firepower

items.content: The deployment and the quickening pace of U.S. strikes, including one Friday, raised new speculation about how far the Trump administration may go in operations it says are targeted at drug trafficking.(Image credit: Evan Vucci)

items.title: U.S to send aircraft carrier to Caribbean

items.content: The Trump administration announced it will send an aircraft carrier towards Latin America in a major escalation of its war on drug cartels. NBC News’ Courtney Kube reports.

items.title: Pentagon deploys top aircraft carrier as Trump militarisation of Caribbean ratchets up
items.standfirst: Use of USS Gerald Ford along with fighter jets comes as president plots strikes against alleged cartels on landThe Pentagon said on Friday that it was deploying the United States’s most advanced aircraft carrier to the Caribbean, a major escalation in the Trump administration’s war against drug cartels that provides the resources to start conducting strikes against targets on the ground.The move will bring the USS Gerald Ford, with dozens of stealth fighter jets and surveillance aircraft, in addition to other warships that accompany the carrier, to the coast of Venezuela as it nears the end of its current deployment in the Mediterranean. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump heads to Asia for diplomatic talks, eyes Kim meeting
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump is set to embark on a tour of Asia aimed at easing trade tensions and mending frayed ties with China, beginning Sunday with a summit of southeast Asian nations in Malaysia before heading to Japan to meet new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi. Trump told reporters that he could meet North Korean leader Kim Jong-un during his trip.

Trump told reporters that he could meet North Korean leader Kim Jong-un during his trip.

items.title: Analyzing Trump's pardon of crypto billionaire Changpeng Zhao
items.standfirst: President Trump pardoned crypto billionaire Changpeng Zhao this week. The president said the Binance founder was recommended by a lot of people for a pardon. Zhao pleaded guilty to money laundering charges in 2023. He was sentenced the next year and spent four months in jail. Kenneth Vogel, reporter for the New York Times, joins "The Daily Report" to discuss.
items.content: President Trump pardoned crypto billionaire Changpeng Zhao this week. The president said the Binance founder was recommended by a lot of people for a pardon. Zhao pleaded guilty to money laundering charges in 2023. He was sentenced the next year and spent four months in jail. Kenneth Vogel, reporter for the New York Times, joins "The Daily Report" to discuss.

items.title: Trump pardons founder of Binance, world’s largest crypto exchange
items.standfirst: Changpeng Zhao pleaded guilty to failing to stop money laundering in 2023 and was sentenced to four monthsDonald Trump issued a pardon for the founder of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange on Thursday.“President Trump exercised his constitutional authority by issuing a pardon for Mr Zhao, who was prosecuted by the Biden administration in their war on cryptocurrency,” a White House statement said. “The war on crypto is over.” Continue reading...
items.content: Changpeng Zhao pleaded guilty to failing to stop money laundering in 2023 and was sentenced to four monthsDonald Trump issued a pardon for the founder of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange on Thursday.“President Trump exercised his constitutional authority by issuing a pardon for Mr Zhao, who was prosecuted by the Biden administration in their war on cryptocurrency,” a White House statement said. “The war on crypto is over.” Continue reading...

items.content: After serving a federal prison sentence for violating anti-money-laundering laws and US sanctions, former crypto exchange CEO Changpeng Zhao has been pardoned by US president Donald Trump.

items.title: US places sanctions on Colombian president over alleged failure to stop cartels
items.standfirst: Treasury accuses Gustavo Petro of ‘allowing drug cartels to flourish’ as president attacks Trump’s ‘oppressive regime’The US treasury department has announced sanctions on Colombian president Gustavo Petro, one of Donald Trump’s harshest international critics.“President Petro has allowed drug cartels to flourish and refused to stop this activity,” treasury secretary Scott Bessent wrote in a post on X. “Today President Trump is taking strong action to protect our nation.” Continue reading...
items.content: Treasury accuses Gustavo Petro of ‘allowing drug cartels to flourish’ as president attacks Trump’s ‘oppressive regime’The US treasury department has announced sanctions on Colombian president Gustavo Petro, one of Donald Trump’s harshest international critics.“President Petro has allowed drug cartels to flourish and refused to stop this activity,” treasury secretary Scott Bessent wrote in a post on X. “Today President Trump is taking strong action to protect our nation.” Continue reading...

items.title: Colombia's president defiant after US sanctions over drug trafficking
items.standfirst: Colombia's President Gustavo Petro on Friday responded with defiance to an announcement by the US that he would face sanctions, along with his wife, son and interior minister, for "allowing drug cartels to flourish". The sanctions come amid a growing spat over drug trafficking that has seen the US destroy several vessels off Colombia's coast.
items.content: Colombia's President Gustavo Petro on Friday responded with defiance to an announcement by the US that he would face sanctions, along with his wife, son and interior minister, for "allowing drug cartels to flourish". The sanctions come amid a growing spat over drug trafficking that has seen the US destroy several vessels off Colombia's coast.

items.standfirst: John Nitti, who served as global head of revenue operations and advertising innovation at X, has left the social media company after just 10 months in the role, according to a report by the Financial Times on Friday. items.standfirst: John Nitti has left his position as X’s advertising chief after just ten months, reports the Financial Times. His departure is the latest in a series of executive exits.

clusters.title: Ivory Coast heads to the polls for presidential elections
clusters.neutral_headline: Ivory Coast Heads to the Polls for Presidential Elections

items.title: Ivory Coast heads to the polls for presidential elections
items.standfirst: The Ivory Coast heads to the polls on Saturday. Five candidates – among them President Alassane Ouattara – are competing for the top job, while several key rivals have been excluded from the race.
items.content: The Ivory Coast heads to the polls on Saturday. Five candidates – among them President Alassane Ouattara – are competing for the top job, while several key rivals have been excluded from the race.

items.title: Ivory Coast presidential election: Who’s standing and what’s at stake?
items.standfirst: Tensions are mounting over President Ouattara's decision to run for a fourth term and a ban on opposition candidates.
items.content: Tensions are mounting over President Ouattara's decision to run for a fourth term and a ban on opposition candidates.

ai_summary: Ivory Coast is holding presidential elections.
Five candidates are competing for the top job.
President Alassane Ouattara is running for a fourth term.
Several key rivals have been excluded from the race.
Tensions are mounting over the election.

clusters.title: US beef prices are soaring. Will Trump's plans lower them?
clusters.neutral_headline: US Beef Prices Soar, Trump Considers Action

items.title: US beef prices are soaring. Will Trump's plans lower them?
items.standfirst: US beef prices are soaring. Will Trump's plans lower them? Beef prices have gotten so high in the US that it has become a political problem. Even Donald Trump, who long ago declared inflation "dead", is talking about it, as the issue threatens to undercut his promises to bring down grocery prices…
items.content: US beef prices are soaring. Will Trump's plans lower them? Beef prices have gotten so high in the US that it has become a political problem. Even Donald Trump, who long ago declared inflation "dead", is talking about it, as the issue threatens to undercut his promises to bring down grocery prices…

items.title: US beef prices are soaring. Will Trump's plans lower them?
items.standfirst: Trump is under fire from ranchers, who say his ideas to lower prices address "symptoms not the problems".
items.content: Trump is under fire from ranchers, who say his ideas to lower prices address "symptoms not the problems".

ai_summary: US beef prices have increased, becoming a political issue for the government.
Donald Trump is addressing inflation, which he previously declared "dead".
Ranchers criticize Trump's plans, saying they address symptoms, not problems.

clusters.title: Where is debris from the White House East Wing demolition being taken?
clusters.neutral_headline: White House East Wing Demolition Debris Removal

items.title: Where is debris from the White House East Wing demolition being taken?
items.standfirst: A red and gray scrap truck carried remnants of the East Wing about six miles from the White House.
items.content: A red and gray scrap truck carried remnants of the East Wing about six miles from the White House.

items.title: White House Staffers Couldn’t Care Less About the East Wing Demolition
items.standfirst: “Not affecting me at all, to be honest,” a White House aide tells WIRED.
items.content: “Not affecting me at all, to be honest,” a White House aide tells WIRED.

clusters.title: Lithuania shuts airports and Belarus border after weather balloon incursion
clusters.neutral_headline: Lithuania Shuts Airports, Belarus Border Due to Balloons

items.title: Lithuania shuts airports and Belarus border after weather balloon incursion
items.standfirst: Vilnius and Kaunas airports closed down after balloons drift into country’s airspace for third time this monthLithuania closed its two biggest airports on Friday and shut crossings on its border with Belarus after helium weather balloons drifted into its territory, the third such occurrence in the Baltic state this month.European aviation has repeatedly been thrown into chaos in recent weeks by drone sightings and other air incursions, including at airports in Copenhagen, Munich and the Baltic region. Continue reading...
items.content: Vilnius and Kaunas airports closed down after balloons drift into country’s airspace for third time this monthLithuania closed its two biggest airports on Friday and shut crossings on its border with Belarus after helium weather balloons drifted into its territory, the third such occurrence in the Baltic state this month.European aviation has repeatedly been thrown into chaos in recent weeks by drone sightings and other air incursions, including at airports in Copenhagen, Munich and the Baltic region. Continue reading...

items.title: Lithuania shuts airports, Belarus border crossings after balloon sightings
items.standfirst: Move to close Vilnius, Kaunas airports and border comes after helium balloons drifted into the country's territory.
items.content: Move to close Vilnius, Kaunas airports and border comes after helium balloons drifted into the country's territory.

ai_summary: Lithuania closed its two major airports due to weather balloons.
The border with Belarus was also shut down due to the balloons.
This is the third such incident this month involving balloons.
European aviation has faced disruptions from drone sightings recently.
